com.pb.sawdust.util

Class Range

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.util.Range
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Integer>

    @Immutable
public class Range
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Integer>
    The Range class is used to create iterable integer sequences. Sequences can be generated in both ascending and descending directions, with user-defined step sizes. This class is inteded to be used as a convenience class, probably in combination with a static import. As an example, the following idiom for looping over an array's indices: 
    
     for(int i = 0; i < array.length; i++) {
         //do something with array[i]
     }
    can be replaced with: 
    
     for(int i : (new Range(array.length))) {
         //do something with array[i]
     }
    Multiple iterators may be safely retrieved and used from an instance of this class concurrently, however, each individual iterator is not thread safe and should not be accessed by multiple threads.

    It is noted that while Range's iterator is performant, it will usually be slower than a well constructed (3-argument) for loop. Thus, for performance critical sections of code, a traditional for loop is preferable.

      Constructor and Description

      Construct a range starting at 0 with a specified end and unitary step size.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Range

        public Range(int start,
     int end,
     int stepSize)
        Constructor specifying the start (inclusive), end (exclusive), and step size of the range. Mathematically, this will create a sequence of numbers over [start,end) with distance between each number in the sequence equal to stepSize.
        Parameters:
        start - The start of the sequence.
        end - The end of the sequence.
        stepSize - The sequence step size.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if stepSize == 0, if (start < end && stepSize < 0), or if (start > end && stepSize > 0).

      • Range

        public Range(int start,
     int end)
        Construct a range with the specified start and end and a unitary step size. If start <= end, then the step size will be 1, otherwise it will be -1.
        Parameters:
        start - The start of the sequence.
        end - The end of the sequence.

      • Range

        public Range(int end)
        Construct a range starting at 0 with a specified end and unitary step size. If 0 <= end, then the step size will be 1, otherwise it will be -1.
        Parameters:
        end - The end of the sequence.

    • Method Detail

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<java.lang.Integer> iterator()
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Integer>

      • getRangeArray

        public int[] getRangeArray()
        Get the range of integers which, when iterated over, would match that returned by this object's iterator.
        Returns:
        the integers in this range ordered in an array.

      • range

        public static Range range(int start,
          int end,
          int stepSize)
        Static convenience method for constructing a range with a specified start, end, and step size. This is intended to be used with static class import, allowing calls to Range.range(...) to be changed to range(...).
        Parameters:
        start - The start of the sequence.
        end - The end of the sequence.
        stepSize - The sequence step size.
        Returns:
        a new range object with start, end, and stepSize.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if stepSize == 0, if (start < end && stepSize < 0), or if (start > end && stepSize > 0).
        See Also:
        Range(int, int, int)

      • range

        public static Range range(int start,
          int end)
        Static convenience method for constructing a range with a specified start, end, and unitary step size. If start <= end, then the step size will be 1, otherwise it will be -1. This is intended to be used with static class import, allowing calls to Range.range(...) to be changed to range(...).
        Parameters:
        start - The start of the sequence.
        end - The end of the sequence.
        Returns:
        a new range object with start, end, and unitary step size.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if stepSize == 0, if (start < end && stepSize < 0), or if (start > end && stepSize > 0).
        See Also:
        Range(int, int)

      • range

        public static Range range(int end)
        Static convenience method for constructing a range starting at 0 with a specified end and unitary step size. If 0 <= end, then the step size will be 1, otherwise it will be -1. This is intended to be used with static class import, allowing calls to Range.range(...) to be changed to range(...).
        Parameters:
        end - The start of the sequence.
        Returns:
        a new range object starting at 0, ending at end, and unitary step size.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if stepSize == 0, if (start < end && stepSize < 0), or if (start > end && stepSize > 0).
        See Also:
        Range(int, int)

      • reverseOf

        public static Range reverseOf(Range range)
        Get a range which is the reverse of the specified range. Specifically, the arrays returned by getRangeArray() called on the input and output Ranges will contain the same elements with opposite ordering.
        Parameters:
        range - The input range.
        Returns:
        a range which is the reverse of range.
